page.title: 18Biography - Life in the area
page.content: Recollections of Mr Jack Elliott...a resident of Deene. "Village life has changed a lot. I was born in Deenethorpe at the start of the century,and I remember walking to Deene School each day...and I had to go home for dinner. I joined the church choir in 1910..there were 24 of us,12 men and 12 boys,and I stayed in the choir until the church closed..I was the only member. When I moved to Deene I worked on the Estate...and continued there until I retired a couple of years ago.I was there for seventy years. When I first came here there was a Post Office, a blacksmith,a pub and I recall a slater working at one of the cottages.There was more social life then. Now every -one keeps to themselves..and village life seems to have gone."
